longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 3 months beyond the period of
  intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports. 

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 1 month for holders
of passports issued by the Palestinian Territory (extension
possible). (SEE NOTE 56126)
    NOTE 56126: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa prior to
   travel.
Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Palestinian Territory
can obtain a single entry visa on arrival. (SEE NOTE 54943)
(SEE NOTE 56126)
    NOTE 54943: Visa on arrival fees:
   - JOD 40.- for stay of max. 2 months and single entry;
   - JOD 60.- valid for 3 months and two entries;
   - JOD 120.- valid for 6 months and multiple entries.
    NOTE 56126: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa prior to
   travel.
- Nationals of Palestinian Territory can obtain a visa free of
  charge, provided 
   (SEE NOTE 56126)
    NOTE 56126: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa prior to
   travel.
- All passengers can obtain a visa on arrival, provided
  attending a scientific or economical conference.  (SEE NOTE
  56126)
    NOTE 56126: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa prior to
   travel.
- Accompanying staff (housemaids, drivers), traveling with
  their employer, can obtain a visa on arrival for a max. stay
  of 3 months.  (SEE NOTE 56126)
    NOTE 56126: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa prior to
   travel.
Additional Information:
- Admission and transit refused to holders of Palestinian
  passports issued by the Palestinian Territory and born in
  the Gaza strip:
  Exempt: those entering Jordan, if holding;
   - permission issued by the Jordanian consulate at Gaza; 
   - Israeli Re-entry Permit ( Lam-Shaml ) or Israeli Identity
  Card;
   - a Residence Permit of a country/territory other than Gaza
  strip and return ticket to that country/territory.
  Exempt: those transiting Jordan, if holding:
   - Israeli Re-entry Permit ("Lam-Shaml"); or
   - permission issued by Jordanian consulate at Gaza. 
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry.
 - Exempt are government workers continuing to Iraq
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Warning:
- All visitors staying in Jordan longer than 14 days have to
  undergo an AIDS test.
 - not required for nationals of Jordan and holders of
   diplomatic and service passports.
